studyDetails.objectives: To determine whether long-term supplementation of goldenseal, black cohosh, kava kava, or valerian extracts affected CYP1A2, CYP2D6, CYP2E1, or CYP3A4/5 activity.
studyDetails.methods: Twelve healthy volunteers were assigned to receive goldenseal, black cohosh, kava kava, or valerian for 28 days with a washout period between each phase. Probe drug cocktails were administered to measure CYP activity changes.
studyDetails.conclusions: Goldenseal strongly inhibited CYP2D6 and CYP3A4/5 activity, kava inhibited CYP2E1, black cohosh weakly inhibited CYP2D6, and valerian showed no significant change.

CYP2D6.Black Cohosh: Statistically significant inhibition (approx. 7%), likely not clinically relevant

CYP1A2.Goldenseal: No data provided for CYP1A2 interactions in the summary
CYP1A2.Black Cohosh: No data provided for CYP1A2 interactions in the summary
CYP1A2.Kava: No data provided for CYP1A2 interactions in the summary
CYP1A2.Valerian: No data provided for CYP1A2 interactions in the summary
